procedure.title: CORK COUNTY STRUCTURE REPAIR WORKS CONTRACT 4, 2024 [Establishment of Framework for Structural Repair Works in Cork County Council Administrative Area]
procedure.description:
**Title:** CORK COUNTY STRUCTURE REPAIR WORKS CONTRACT 4, 2024 [Establishment of Framework for Structural Repair Works in Cork County Council Administrative Area]

**Description:**
This contract aims to repair the existing structure of Kilbarry Bridge (L-60391 Macroom MD) and establish a framework for future structural repair works in the Cork County Council administrative area. The proposed works include:
- **Grouting of the abutments and arch up to quarter points**
- **Installation of 2no. tie bars at the quarter points of the arch**
- **Installation of 2no. ground anchors at the left-hand side downstream wing wall**
- **Reinforced gunite spray to be applied to the arch, abutments, and left-hand side downstream wing wall**
- **Concrete scour repairs to the southwest wing wall and right-hand side abutment**
- **Localised masonry repairs and repointing of the existing arch, spandrel, and wing walls as required**
- **Reconstruction of the 2.4m damaged section of the upstream parapet and crack repairs**
- **Taking up the grass verges and replacing them with rubbing strips along the parapets**
- **Surface dressing the bridge and approaches**
- **Acting as Principal Contractor for the construction works**

The framework is anticipated to run for 2 years with the possibility of extending for a further 2 years at the discretion of the Contracting Authority. The anticipated framework value is €5.5 million excluding VAT over the anticipated 4-year duration.

**Eligibility Criteria:**
- The bidder must have a proven track record in structural repair works, particularly in bridge maintenance.
- The bidder should have experience with similar projects involving complex structural repairs.
- The bidder must demonstrate a strong understanding of health and safety protocols and environmental regulations.
- The bidder should have a robust project management system in place to ensure timely completion and quality of work.
- The bidder must provide comprehensive insurance coverage for the duration of the contract.
- The bidder should have a good financial standing and the ability to manage large-scale projects.

**Evaluation Criteria:**
- Technical competence and experience in structural repair works.
- Financial stability and ability to manage the project budget.
- Project management capabilities and track record of completing similar projects on time.
- Health and safety protocols and compliance with environmental regulations.
- Quality of work and ability to meet the specified requirements.
- References from previous clients and case studies of similar projects.

**Submission Requirements:**
- A detailed project proposal outlining the bidder's approach to the repair works and the framework establishment.
- A comprehensive project timeline and milestones.
- A detailed breakdown of the costs involved, including all materials and labor.
- Proof of insurance coverage and financial stability.
- References from previous clients and case studies of similar projects.

By responding to this public tender, bidders will be effectively contributing to the maintenance and improvement of critical infrastructure in Cork County, ensuring the safety and accessibility of the community. The successful bidder will be responsible for delivering high-quality structural repair works and establishing a robust framework for future maintenance, thereby supporting the long-term sustainability of Cork County's infrastructure.

lots.title: CORK COUNTY STRUCTURE REPAIR WORKS CONTRACT 4, 2024 [Establishment of Framework for Structural Repair Works in Cork County Council Administrative Area]
lots.description:
**Title:** CORK COUNTY STRUCTURE REPAIR WORKS CONTRACT 4, 2024 [Establishment of Framework for Structural Repair Works in Cork County Council Administrative Area]

**Description:**
This contract aims to repair the existing structure of Kilbarry Bridge (L-60391 Macroom MD) and establish a framework for future structural repair works within the Cork County Council administrative area. The proposed works include:

- **Grouting of the abutments and arch up to quarter points**
- **Installation of 2no. tie bars at the quarter points of the arch**
- **Installation of 2no. ground anchors at the left-hand side downstream wing wall**
- **Reinforced gunite spray to be applied to the arch, abutments, and left-hand side downstream wing wall**
- **Concrete scour repairs to the southwest wing wall and right-hand side abutment**
- **Localised masonry repairs and repointing of the existing arch, spandrel, and wing walls as required**
- **Reconstruction of the 2.4m damaged section of the upstream parapet and crack repairs**
- **Taking up the grass verges and replacing them with rubbing strips along the parapets**
- **Surface dressing the bridge and approaches**
- **Acting as Principal Site Contract Supervisor (PSCS) for the construction works**

The framework is anticipated to run for 2 years with the possibility of extending for a further 2 years at the discretion of the Contracting Authority. The total anticipated framework value is €5.5 million (excluding VAT) over the anticipated 4-year duration.

Cork County Council is the second-largest local authority in the Republic of Ireland and the largest based on geographic area size. The council services a population of approximately 332,255 people and has an annual revenue budget of €338 million. The council provides a broad range of diverse services including housing, roads, planning, environment, libraries, fire service, community funding, LEADER, and arts and heritage. The successful bidder will need to demonstrate experience in structural repair works, particularly in bridge maintenance, and the ability to manage complex projects within a local government framework. The bidder should also have a proven track record of collaborating with local authorities and adhering to safety standards. The framework will require a contractor who can ensure timely completion of repairs, maintain high-quality workmanship, and provide effective site supervision. The bidder should be able to provide detailed project timelines, cost estimates, and a comprehensive plan for managing the framework over its duration.
